meanings.definition: A gradual change or transition from one thing to another.
meanings.sent1: The artist used a gradation of colors to create a beautiful sunset painting.
meanings.sent2: The gradation of colors in the sky from blue to orange was breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The gradation of flavors in the cake made it taste like a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions went through a gradation from joy to sadness as she read the letter.
meanings.sent5: The gradation of the music volume added depth to the performance.

meanings.definition: A degree or stage in a series of gradual changes.
meanings.sent1: Each gradation of difficulty in the game challenged the players more.
meanings.sent2: She reached a new gradation of expertise in her painting skills.
meanings.sent3: The gradation of spiciness in the chili made it impossible to stop eating.
meanings.sent4: His success was marked by a gradation of promotions within the company.
meanings.sent5: The gradation of temperatures throughout the day affected the crops differently.

meanings.definition: The act or process of grading or arranging in a series.
meanings.sent1: The gradation of students based on their test scores was fair.
meanings.sent2: She carefully oversaw the gradation of colors in the design project.
meanings.sent3: The gradation of sizes in the clothing store made it easy to find the right fit.
meanings.sent4: The gradation of tasks in the project plan ensured a smooth workflow.
meanings.sent5: His attention to detail in the gradation of flavors in the dish impressed the judges.
